result.execSummary:
The defendant Stuart K. Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Defendant may petition for early termination of probation at any time that the agent deems appropriate, provided all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with H. Hoffman except contact authorized or ordered by the family court.
Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart K. Kramer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Inmate Request to the Court - DE requesting release for medical treatment - Request denied by the Court, to be determined by jail medical personnel

Case called @ 2:52 p.m. Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court with attorney Michael Ross Blum.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Repeater enhancer DRI.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Blum. No statement by DE. Court orders: 75 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: NC w/ H. Hoffman unless authorized in family court, any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.   Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term at any time that the agent deems appropriate, provided all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Appeal rights given.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Michael Ross Blum in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Blum:  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court with attorney Michael Ross Blum.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests add'l time for STC as just rec'd appointment.  Discovery needs to be exchanged as well.  STC adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:10 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Stuart K. Kramer in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def wants counsel - states he is not employed and cannot retain his own counsel.  Defendant referred to SPD for eligibility process.   NGP entered by Court.  The Court:  Orders $1000 w/conditions.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
